page.title: 10Scotch Quarry (C)
page.content: Scotch Quarry is on Dale Street in the Primrose area of the city. It was used as a Limestone Quarry until the Second World War,then as a tip by the County Council until l978. In 1979 it was proposed to develop the site as a children's Summer playground. Local residents objected to the plan because they thought it would attract hooligans and vandals. At a public meeting Cllr Mrs J Yates said "This area is where 700 children living in terraced houses have nowhere to play except the street" and she urged them to "see how the scheme worked". With the aid of the Manpower Services Commission, the work of landscaping the park began in 1983 and the park opened in 1984.During the Summer holidays a playscheme operates in the park and various activities and outings are arranged, supervised by a full-time activities organiser.
